intro: Satureja teydensis, commonly known as Persian savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pink or purple flowers in the summer. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine and cuisine for their pungent, slightly spicy aroma. Satureja teydensis is valued for its medicinal properties, including antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory effects.
